issue.title: [CF 794] Trouble with Plague Strike Icon
issue.body:
I have the following Plague Strike icon that is supposed to show when blood plague is about to drop off and is supposed to tell me if I have at least 1 unholy rune so i do not waste a death rune casting plague strike:

^1^T^SType^Sconditionicon ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SDEBUFFDUR ^SChecked^B ^SOperator^S< ^SUnit^Starget ^SName^SBlood~`Plague ^SLevel^N3.4 ^t^N2^T ^SType^SLUA ^SName^S(GetRuneType(3)==2~`and~`GetRuneCount(3)~`or~`0)+(GetRuneType(4)==2~`and~`GetRuneCount(4)~`or~`0))>=1 ^t^Sn^N2 ^t^SCustomTex^SPlague~`Strike ^SEnabled^B ^t^N61501^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

However, it should disappear when blood plague is on the target but it does not. I think it is an issue with the lua condition since it does not happen when I delete it. Let me know if you can see any problems. Thanks!


> Posted by CurseForge user DKFROSTDPS | Imported from CurseForge issue #794 | Raw

comments.body:
Your Lua condition is not valid Lua syntax. You are missing an opening parenthesis at the beginning of it.

Should be

``` ((GetRuneType(3)==2 and GetRuneCount(3) or 0)+(GetRuneType(4)==2 and GetRuneCount(4) or 0))>=1 ```

In the future, enable Lua errors to catch these.

Edited Apr 21, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Works perfectly now. Thank you!


> Posted by CurseForge user DKFROSTDPS
